When I saw 'The Village' on its opening weekend, I walked out...pissed off.  Since then I've been asking myself just why it was such a terrible movie.  I've stayed up for hours at night thinking of the answer to this question.  Not because I couldnt find one, but because there were so many reasons.

Here's the Village in a few easy steps.  Yes, it will spoil the movie, so if you want to see it, dont read it

Step 1: 'Holy shit!  Don't go into the forest or these things will kill you!'
Step 2: 'Hi, I'm Joaquin Phoenix, I am rebelious and inquisitive, I also love this blind chick.'
Step 3: (Enter 'scary bullshit) 'Holy crap!  did you see that?  That was lame, but none the less we're scared shitless. (Enter long, boring love interest story line -Yawn-)
Step 4: 'Hi, I'm the Village retard, I love the blind chick too and when Joaquin and her get engaged, I stab Joaquin a bunch.'
Step 5: 'Holy Crap!  The retard stabbed him!  Lock him up!  The doctor cant fix him, so lets send the blind chick into the forest to the next town and find medicine.'
Step 6: 'Hi, we're the elders.  We Lied to you all your entire lives!!!  HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!  We're the monsters!!!!  Blind chick: AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH.'
Step 7: 'Well, I'm fucking blind and walking in the forest.  Holy crap!  Its one of the beasts!  But I know they're fake, so what the fuck is going on?  Oh well, I'll lead it into this big ass pit and kill it.'
Step 8: 'Hey!  The room we locked the retard in had a beast costume hidden inside it.  Fucking oops!'
Step 9: 'Hi!  I'm a security guard for a Natural Habitat Perserve.  What the hell is this chick doing climbing over the fence?  Wait, she's kinda hot, so I'll drive her back to the guard shack and see my boss M. Night Shyamalan, maybe he'll know what to do.'
Step 10: 'Hi, I'm M. Night Shyamalan, shamelessly plugging myself into another of my movies, kinda like Steven King does, but I'm better because my movies suck worse.  (all while he jacks off to pictures of King).  I'll pretend not to notice my guard stealing medical supplies and  bitch about the 'hard times' I've had while working here.'
Step 11: 'Well, I'm back from the other town with Medicine.  Hurray!  Joaquin's saved.'
Step 12: 'Hi, we're the Village elders again.  We were all a bunch of people who met in a therapy group and this fuck up of a leader convinced us this was all a good idea.  Anit that a bitch?'

The end.  It's amazing, I could have read that on the movie screen and walked out a thousand times more pleased with the movie then I was.  THe movie is about 30 minutes long, with about a hour and a half of meaningless, boring crap that we all figured out in the first 10 minutes of the movie.  Hurray for the village, best movie I've seen since 'I am Sam'.  Seriously though, all these critics are saying its the best movie of the summer.  And it would have been too, had the summer been filled with equally boring and shitty movies, but it wasnt.  We have Spiderman 2, Hero, hell even AvP looks mildly more entertaining then the village.  I also love how they say its a thriller and scary as hell.  Well, it is scary...for about 5 minutes, and it is thrilling, I know I was thrilled when it was over.  Its not scary, or thrilling, its just dog shit.  He goes from making great movies like the 6th sense to...this.  Sad.  What?  It's sad that he's making movies this crappy now?  No, IM sad cuz I wasted good money and time on the movie.
The Village is just like its title, dull and uninteresting.  M. Night Shyamalan would have done a lot better cutting 90% of the movie out and making it a short flim and plugging it into Sundance or something, because this was 2 hours of pain sitting in a uncomfortable movie chair with boring shit on the screen.
-Yawn-

Alright, this Atkin's diet has gone to far...seriously.

'Its a miracle diet!'  'I lost 300 pounds on the Atkin's diet'

Yeah well I gained a net 0 pounds by not following the Atkins diet.  When Beer companies start advertising their new low carb beers, shit has gone to far.  Everyone's running around eatting all this low carb shit, all jsut to lose weight.  The Atkin's diet is nothing new, hell, its about as old as I am, so why the sudden realization of it?  But lets get down to business folks.  
Does the Atkin's diet work?  yes.  there's no question that it works, however there are some flaws to it.  so, just what are carbs?  you know when you walk?  you're using carbs.  You know when you pick up that low carb shit you're ingesting?  you're using carbs.  Carbohydrates fuel your body, did you know that?  While its true that excess carbs in your body does turn to fat, the conversion between carbs and fat is minimal.  
I understand if you want to lose weight, but there are easier, better yet ways that far more improve your health.  Here's a tip.  When you're going to McDonalds, turn your car around and go somewhere else.  Why?  FATTY FOODS dumbass!  Get a goddamn clue.  If some food is low on Carbs, is it low on fat?  generally, yes, but not always.  You want to lose wieght?  fine, eat healthy, eat carbs, WORK THE FUCK OUT!  walk 10 blocks each day (note walk, not run.  Running damages your lungs, knees, etc.).  Go to a damn gym 3 times a week for a hour.  There is no call for eatting strictly low carb stuff.  Hell, while you're working out, eat fatty foods, so long as your base diet includes a vast majority of low fat and saturated fat, you'll shed those pounds like a cat sheds in summer. 
PUT DOWN THE FORK!
its really that damn simple.

Low carb beer?  HA!  98% of the people who are at a bar dont think to themselves as they're ordering: 'Oh shit!  does that beer have 20 or 5 carbs in it?'

Gimmie a goddamn break.

Nobody did a better job then Johnny, and thats final. Fucking oscars, they just get worse and worse as time goes on.

'I suppose i should start by appologizing then?'  I asked.
'Appologizing for?'  She Inquired.
'Well...when last we met, we left under difficult circumstances.  Then i simply ignored you for a year, and then, when i came back i continued to ignore you.  Isn't that enough for an appology?'
'It was not entirly your fault Dan.'  She said.  ' I could have just as easily written a letter to you, so i suppose part of that blame rests with me.'
I leaned foreword again to take another drink from my mug.  she slid back in her chair, atleast she felt as uncomfortable about all this as i did.  She looked unhappy now.  I had stirred up memories and emotions that she'd pushed back for a year.  She tried her best to hold back her tears, but try as she might, one managed to escape and roll down her cheek.  slowly i brought my hand to her cheek and let the tear roll onto my finger, she let out a little smile.
'I'm an idiot Valerie.' I told her.  'Looking back on what happened, it was a mistake, one of many I made during that time.  I never should have left you, I should have never left here.  I knew it seconds later after i did it.'
'And yet you still went through with it all...' Valerie said as more tears rolled down her face.  'Why?'
'I...have no idea.'  I confessed.  'Had i known what would result of it all, I would have done differently. Again i was at a loss for words,  I could feel the tears welling in my own eyes, and it took my concentration to push them back.  I promised myself i wouldn't get emotional.  Valerie sat with her eyes closed, arms folded accross her chest.  The rest of the taverns patrons paid no attention to us, which i was thankfull for.  While we sat, I finished my drink and then moved on the the second one. 
Half way through that mug she spoke again.  'What's your point Dan?'  She asked coldly and abrutly.
'My point?'  I asked.  'My point is that I'm sorry for what i did to you...I guess.'  
'That's not what i mean and you know it.' she scolded.
I sighed.  She found me out, but that was hardly news.  She always had her way of reading my mind.  'I still love you Val...' I whispered.  'And i can't change what happened between us.  If you could see the hundreds of letters i wrote you but never sent.  Not a day went by when i didn't wish to be by your side, there was hardly a moment that you didn't come into my mind.  It tore me apart that the only thing i ever wanted in this world was unreachable for me and it was all due to my own foolishness.  I managed to ruin not only the greatest friendship i've ever had, but also the greatest relationship I ever had.'  I started crying now. 'Well...' She announced, breaking the silence.  'I've got things to do, so I'll get going now.'  She stood up and walked over to me and gave me a hug.  Instinctivly i hugged back.  With a kiss to my forehead she left.  I sat motionless for hours.  Occasionally the waitress would walk by and ask a question of me but i would wave her off.  
When finally the crowd in the tavern started to disperse, i sat up and walked out.  The cold air was soothing, the night was dead quiet.  My thoughts and emotions had been burnt out, i felt numb.  Only the soft crunching of the snow beneath by heavy iron boots could be heard, like the whole world felt my pain and took this moment in silence in honor of it.  The weight of my armor dragged me down.  I knew i should get to bed, I had a long day of riding ahead of me and battles to plan, but what was the use?  What was the use of going on when the only thing that mattered to me in this world was beyond my reach, and essentially dead to me?  While the war was important, it felt small in comparison to my own woes.
That was the longest walk of my life, and when finally i reached the barracks, Alan and Joseph greeted me.  Instantly they realized what had happened, and said nothing more then a greeting, while they were like my brothers, it would have to wait till the morning before i would confide in them my secret.
